title: Economic fears and Greek crisis weigh on markets â business live | Business | The Guardian
summary: markets continue to tumble as oil hits five and a half year low .
s & p keeps uk rating at aaa .
draghi to tell politicians to get a grip .
ftse on track for worst week in three years .
photos : protests as italy holds general strike .

documents.title: markets continue to tumble as oil hits five and a half year low
text: it was a grim end to the week for investors .
more evidence of a slowdown in china , with disappointing industrial production figures , set the tone for another tough day .
with the continuing worries about the prospects for greece and the eurozone ahead of next week 's snap presidential election , there was little optimism around .
brent crude slumped nearly 3 % at one point to below $ 61 a barrel , a new five and a half year low .

the final scores showed : the ftse 100 fell 161.07 points or 2.49 % to 6300.63 germany 's dax dropped 2.72 % to 9594.73 france 's cac closed down 2.77 % at 4108.93 italy 's ftse mib fell 3.13 % to 18,600.83 spain 's ibex ended down 2.75 % at 10,145.0 the athens market dipped another 0.42 % to 824.49 on wall street the dow jones industrial average is currently 201 points or 1.14 % lower .
on that , rather downbeat note , it 's time to close up for the evening .
thanks for all your comments , have a good weekend , and we 'll be back on monday .

on the uk and europe , s & p says : we view eu membership as key to longer term fiscal and growth outcomes in the u.k. , given that the eu has traditionally been the destination for more than 45 % of the u.k. 's net exports of financial services .
we believe that , if the u.k. were to leave the eu , the u.k. 's economic prospects would weaken .

s & p 's reasons for keeping its rating on the uk : the affirmation reflects our opinion that the u.k. continues to exhibit high labor- and product-market flexibility , and a wealthy and diversified economy .
we view the u.k. 's monetary flexibility as a key credit strength .
it enables wages and prices to adjust rapidly , relative to trading partners .
this boosts the economy 's resilience and competitiveness without generating deflationary pressures .
the u.k. 's monetary authorities have drawn on the flexibility afforded by a reserve currency and this has benefited public debt sustainability , in our view .
we expect the u.k. economy to expand by more than 3.0 % this year and 2.7 % in 2015 , as domestic demand benefits from further job creation and private-sector wage growth gradually returns .
our base case is that labor productivity growth ( after adjusting for the long-term decline in north sea output ) will gradually recover as the business cycle gains traction and investment expands .

nevertheless , low interest rates and de-risking in the financial services sector ( the output of which is indirectly measured via interest margins ) will preclude financial-sector productivity fully returning to pre-crisis levels over the 2014-2017 forecast horizon , in our view .
u.k. financial and insurance services make up roughly 9 % of 2013 gdp .
financial sector conditions also affect the u.k. 's balance of payments .

the most important contributor to the deterioration in the u.k. 's current account balance-to 4.2 % of gdp ( 2013 outcome ) currently from 2.0 % pre-crisis ( 1998-2007 average ) -is the shift in the incomes component of the current account deficit .
it has gone from a pre-crisis surplus ( 1.2 % of gdp in 1998-2007 ) to a deficit of 0.8 % of gdp in 2013 .
recent revisions to the u.k. 's national accounts indicate that the 2008-2009 recession was less severe than previously thought .
as a consequence , annual average 2008-2012 gdp growth was revised 0.5 percentage points higher , reflecting primarily upward revisions to investment .
at end-september 2014 , national accounts revisions also led to an upward adjustment in nominal gdp by just over 6 % for 2013 .
this revision has led us to lower our estimate of 2014 net general government debt by 2.8 percentage points to 82 % of gdp , from 85 % .
in accordance with esa2010 treatment , we have included just under 2 % of gdp of network rail debt in our estimate of general government debt .

historically , we have always classified the treasury 's lloyds and royal bank of scotland share purchases as illiquid assets ( until these are sold ) ; hence , the introduction of esa2010 did not affect our estimates of the treasury 's liquid general government assets .
the full report is here .

here are the reuters snaps on the s & p report on the uk 's rating : 12-dec-2014 17:10 - s & p says ratings on the united kingdom affirmed at aaa/a-1+ ' ; outlook stable 12-dec-2014 17:11 - s & p says also affirmed aaa/a-1+ ' long- and short-term issuer credit ratings of bank of england 12-dec-2014 17:11 - s & p says also affirmed the aaa/a-1+ ' ratings on the debt program of network rail infrastructure finance plc 12-dec-2014 17:12 - s & p says affirmation reflects opinion u.k. continues to exhibit high labor- and product-market flexibility , and a wealthy and diversified economy 12-dec-2014 17:12 - s & p says expect the u.k. economy to expand by more than 3.0 % this year and 2.7 % in 2015 12-dec-2014 17:13 - s & p says believe u.k. 's general government deficit will decline more slowly than official projections , to 5.4 % of gdp in calendar-year 2014 12-dec-2014 17:14 - s & p says stable outlook on u.k .
reflects opinion that there is a less than one-in-three probability of a downgrade over the next two years 12-dec-2014 17:16 - s & p says believe that , if the u.k .
were to leave the eu , the u.k. 's economic prospects would weaken

documents.title: s & p keeps uk rating at aaa
text: standard and poor 's has reaffirmed the uk 's credit rating at aaa , the agency has announced .
back with greece , and the eu seems to be adding further fuel to the fire following jean claude juncker 's statements earlier .

it has released the programme of eu finance minister pierre moscovici 's two-day visit to greece but this does not include meeting with opposition party syriza , currently ahead in the polls , writes helena smith .
controversy over the policy of freezing syriza out is likely to build over the weekend .

juncker 's spokesman , margaritis schinas , ironically a greek national , announced today that the eu commission president 's earlier statements - in which he appeared to be urging people not to elect syriza - could be interpreted in a multiple of ways .
there are many ways of interpreting what he may mean , he said .
the greek prime minister antonis samaras , who will chair meetings at the finance , administrative reform and development ministries on monday morning , will meet moscovici later that day .
falling oil prices may be causing concern in the stock markets , as a sign of weaker global demand , but they have helped boost us consumer confidence .
the preliminary reading of the thomson reuters/university of michigan consumer sentiment index for december came in at a near eight year high of 93.8 .
apart from falling fuel costs , consumers were also buoyed by improved prospects for jobs and wages .
this latest reading , the highest since january 2007 , was better than the expected level of 89.5 and up from november 's final reading of 88.8 .
survey director richard curtin said : expected wage gains rose to their highest level since 2008 , and consumers voiced the most favourable buying attitudes in several decades .
the news has helped pull markets up from their lowest levels , with the dow jones industrial average now down 39 points .
wall street has opened , and after an overnight rise on the dow jones industrial average , the us market has followed the rest of the world into the red .
the dow is currently 85 points or 0.48 % lower while the s & p 500 is down 0.41 % , which would end the latter 's seven week winning streak .
us producer prices fell 0.2 % last month , sharper than expected 0.1 % decline in the wake of the recent plunge in oil prices .
but the core measure , excluding food , energy and trade services , was flat .
year on year the core index was up just 1.5 % , showing weak inflationary pressures which could cause difficulties for the us federal reserve in its debate over when to raise interest rates .
the fed 's latest meeting takes place next week , and the key sentence about keeping borrowing costs low for a considerable time will be widely watched for any variation .

documents.title: lunchtime round-up : european markets suffer a bad week
text: a quick recap .
european stock markets are on track for their worst week in over two years , after another day of falls across the markets .
the greek political crisis , weak chinese industrial data , fears over the eurozone economy , and the declining oil price all hit shares .
the ftse 10 has shed another 82 points , and could suffer its biggest weekly loss since september 2011 .
european stock markets , lunchtime , december 12 2014 reuters otherwise , there are familiar themes playing out today .
the russian central bank appears to have intervened in the fx markets , but that did n't prevent the ruble hit fresh record lows .
yesterday 's interest rate hike is failing to provide support .
the oil price has hit new lows not seen since 2009 , with brent below $ 63 per barrel and us crude around $ 59/barrel .
the latest decline came as the energy watchdog cut its oil growth forecasts , and warned that the crash in oil prices may not help the world economy much .
there 's a general strike underway in italy and clashes at an anti-austerity march in milan .

documents.title: syriza angered by juncker comments
text: greece 's syriza party along with sympathisers in the media have lambasted jean claude juncker 's intervention earlier today as the worst kind of terror tactics at play .

from athens , helena smith reports : european forces , they said , had decided to react to the possibility of the radical leftists winning power by staging an all-out terror campaign aimed at rallying support for the government 's choice of president and avoiding early elections .

efimerida syntaton , which is closely aligned to the far left group , wrote : a senior european figure has made another hard-hitting intervention in the political life of the country in order to ensure the continuation of memorandum [ bailout ] policies in greece .
the paper quoted senior party officials as saying that it was understandable as those who backed the austerity laid out in the bailout accords supported each other .
pierre moscovici , the eu 's finance minister is due in athens on monday .
regular readers will recall that this is not that the ex luxembourg prime minister has publicly aired his views about tsipras .
in may moscovici told an interviewer that he regarded the radical leftist as a a major danger for greece .
i am willing to cooperate , but i do n't think he [ tsipras ] is willing to be cooperative with me if he becomes prime minister .
this a major danger for greece , because i do n't think he understands the problems of the country ¦ i do n't think he ( tsipras ) is the right man for greece at this very moment .

meanwhile syriza 's paralimentary spokesman , panaghiotis lafazanis , delivered a rocket in the greek parliament this morning , insisting if it assumed office the party would not only cancel the memorandum signed by greece and its creditors , but ensure the troika leaves greece .
lafazanis told mps : we are a sovereign and independent country and we will take our decisions and say that the troika and the memoranda are not in the interests of the country .
and we will move ahead with the cancellation of the memoranda and the troika will leave greece .
that is a commitment that is linked to the interest of the country it goes without saying that a government can take unilateral actions ¦ .
the idea that it can not is unacceptable , an invention of the memorandum regime .

riot police and protestors have clashed in milan , during the anti-austerity protests marking today 's general strike : police officers and protesters during clashes as part of a nationwide strike , in milan , northern italy , 12 december 2014 .
bazzi/epa police officers and protesters during clashes as part of a nationwide strike , in milan , northern italy , 12 december 2014 .
bazzi/epa police officers band together near protesters during clashes as part of a nationwide strike , in milan , northern italy , 12 december 2014 .
bazzi/epa

documents.title: draghi to tell politicians to get a grip
text: the president of the european central bank is poised to deliver an almighty rocket to europe 's leaders to reform their economies and stimulate growth , reuters reports .
they reckon mario draghi will push the leaders of europe 's three biggest economies to do more , rather than relying on the ecb .

the head of the european central bank is set to tell european leaders in stark terms at a summit next week that they need to reform straggling economies or risk blunting an ambitious monetary offensive to help revive the stagnant euro zone .

as the central bank inches closer to printing money to buy government bonds , mario draghi has become increasingly worried about slack reform in countries such as france and italy , which he fears will undermine the long-term boost from so-called quantitative easing ( qe ) .

on dec. 18 , draghi will urge leaders including french president francois hollande and italian prime minister matteo renzi to step up reforms and hold down spending , people familiar with ecb thinking say .

he wants german chancellor angela merkel , by contrast , to invest more in infrastructure and boost domestic demand this is tricky territory for an unelected central banker , who should n't really be telling elected politicians what to do .
and he has recently denied that the ecb could agree to a qe for reforms bargain .
but given there has been little progress since draghi saved the euro with his whatever it takes speech in july 2012 , his impatience is understandable .
full story .
lorcan roche kelly ( @ lorcanrk ) this is the big @ twitterid battle for 2015 rt @ twitterid : draghi to urge european leaders to reform to back ecb stimulus
a sign advertising currency exchange rates in moscow today .
zemlianichenko/ap muscovites get a daily reminder of the slump in the rouble , thanks to electronic signs showing the latest exchange rates .
the currency has lost another 2 % of value today , trading at 57.5 roubles to the us dollar .
the cost of insuring russian government debt has continued to climb today , as the ruble and the oil price both fall .
the five-year russian credit default swap rose by 18 basis points to 442 , up from 424 yesterday .
that means it costs ¬442,000 per year to insure ¬10m of five-year bonds , and is a five and a half-year high .
this might displease juncker ; the latest opinion poll from greece shows the left-wing syriza party holding a five point lead over new democracy ( currently in power ) .

efthimia efthimiou ( @ efiefthimiou ) # greece interview poll : syriza 28.3 , nd 25.2 , kke 5.5 , pasok 4.7 , to potami 4.5 , goldawn 4.3 , indgreeks 1.7 , demleft 0.7 there 's no election at this stage , though - but one could come in late january if the greek parliament rejects the government 's presidential nominee , stavros dimas .
the uncertainty has sent the cost of insuring greek bonds soaring : markit ( @ markit ) greek cds spreads have surged 139 % since april 's lows
jean-claude juncker has also admitted that the revelations of massive tax avoidance through luxembourg , which he ran for years , have hurt his reputation as head of the commission .
he told my colleague ian traynor that : i do n't feel damaged subjectively because i know what i did and i did not do .
but i am not naive , not a village idiot , and i have to objectively take on board that many people in europe now have doubts about the honourable side of the new commission president .
i have to live with that .
ian traynor ( @ traynorbrussels ) # luxleax @ twitterid admits there are doubts on his fitness to lead @ twitterid commission , but
european commission president jean-claude juncker has caused a stir in greece , after appearing to urged the population not to elect the left-wing syriza party .
in what may prove a counter-productive intervention , juncker told an austrian tv station that he hoped extreme forces would n't take power in greece .
i think that the greeks who have a very difficult life know very well what a wrong election result would mean for greece and the eurozone .
nick malkoutzis ( @ nickmalkoutzis ) regardless if # greece will go to snap polls , @ twitterid has chosen sides .

he wants `` known faces '' not `` extreme forces '' keep talking greece ( @ keeptalkinggr ) blatant intervention : ec juncker tells greek voters to avoid wrong outcome ' in elections wolf ( @ wolf juncker has just managed to exceed samaras in terms of useless and counterproductive statements # greece

documents.title: ftse on track for worst week in three years
text: london 's stock market is on track for its worst week since the eurozone crisis began to escalate more than three years ago .
the ftse 100 has now shed 96 points , or 1.5 % , to 6365 .
that takes the decline this week to around 5.6 % .

that 's the biggest weekly fall since september 2011 , my colleague nick fletcher flags up : the prospect of a new eurozone crisis after greece brought forward its presidential election continues to unsettle investors , while the downbeat news on the economy continued with disappointing chinese industrial production figures .
ftse 100 set for worst week since 2011 but water companies bubble up ftse 100 over the last five years .
reuters the steady decline in the oil price ( down another 1 % today ) continues to hit energy stocks .
petrofac , which provides services to the oil industry , has shed another 4.6 % after the iea cut its demand forecasts ( details ) .
the french , german , italian and spanish markets are all down at least 1 % .
there is a glimmer of hope in athens ; the main greek index is slightly higher today , ending a slump that wiped 20 % off shares this week .

documents.title: photos : protests as italy holds general strike
text: students marching in protest in milan .
bruno/ap over in italy , thousands of people are taking part in anti-austerity protests as the country 's two biggest unions hold a general strike .
schools , hospitals , airports , highways , ports and public transport have been hit , as workers protests against the government 's labour market reforms .

some demonstrators are carrying balloons de prime minister matteo renzi as cartoon character pinocchio , unions oppose rensi 's plans to make it easier to fire workers ( designed to encourage firms to actually take staff on ) , and planned spending cuts in the 2015 budget .
more than 50 rallies or protest marches are scheduled across italy , under the slogan cosi non va !
or this is not the right way .
here 's some photos : balloons featuring italian prime minister matteo renzi as pinocchio in rome .
bouys/afp/getty images a demonstrator wears a headgear reading thats 's enough ! '
in rome .
carconi/epa a rally in rome .
carconi/epa jonah hull ( @ jonahhull ) unions set off on a day of nationwide strikes against labour reforms , in rome .
eurozone factories barely grew in october , underlining the weak state of the economy .
industrial production in the euro area rose by just 0.1 % during the month , half as fast as hoped .

that means production has grown by a meagre 0.7 % over the last year , and 0.8 % in the wider european union.. steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) more weakish ez data i/p at 0.1 % mm a tenth weaker than expected and there was a revision down to the previous month from 0.6 to 0.5 .

over the last year , the highest increases in industrial production were registered in ireland ( +38.8 % ) , romania and slovenia ( both +3.9 % ) , and the largest decreases in denmark and italy ( both -3.0 % ) and the netherlands ( -1.4 % ) , eurostat adds .

the slowdown in britain 's construction sector highlights the challengers facing builders , says stefan friedhoff , global corporates managing director for construction at lloyds bank commercial banking : construction companies are grappling with myriad issues , including inflation-led cost overruns , a competitive bidding environment and labour constraints .
the shortage of skilled workers is undermining current output levels and , unchecked , it threatens the long-term health of the sector .
the central bank of the russian federation may have thrown $ 700m at the ruble this morning after it hit new lows ( details ) , reuters reports .
russian cenbank likely intervening on forex market on friday , possibly spending $ 700 mln , after rouble hits new lows - traders - rtrs

documents.title: uk construction sector growth slows
text: britain 's construction sector weakened in october , according to new data from the office for national statistics .
the ons reports that construction output fell by 2.2 % month-on month , with activity falling across the industry .
both new work and repair and maintenance decreased , by 1.7 % and 3.1 % respectively .
in the new work category , only public other new work saw an increase ; all repair and maintenance work categories experienced a fall in work in october .
this means construction growth was only 0.7 % higher than in october 2013 , which is the weakest year-on-year growth since may 2013 .
but on a happier note , the ons has revised its estimate for output in the third quarter of 2014 to 1.6 % growth , up from 0.8 % .
that means the economy probably grew 0.1 % faster than first estimated .

documents.title: glut fears drive brent crude lower
text: the oil price has fallen further after the iea cut its demand forecasts .
brent crude has fallen another 1.3 % today to $ 62.83 per barrel , a new five and a half-year low .
and us crude is down 1.6 % at just $ 58.97 per barrel .
italy 's inflation rate was a little higher than expected last month , but remains worryingly low .
the annual harmonised italian consumer prices index rose by 0.3 % in november , statistics body istat said , up from 0.2 % first estimated .
on a month-on-month basis , prices fell by 0.2 % .
jamali/ap the slump in the oil price may give little boost to the global economy , the international energy agency has just warned .
in its latest monthly report , the world energy watchdog cut its forecast for demand growth in 2015 by 230 000 barrels per day , to 900,000 per day .

the iea predicted that the plunge in the oil price is unlikely to result on lower supplies soon : barring a disorderly production response , it may well take some time for supply and demand to respond to the price rout , and the iea also suggested that the stimulus effect from the drop in crude prices may be modest , as weak oil demand was itself a key factor behind falling prices .
the rouble is fluctuating wildly this morning , amid reports that the russia 's central bank may have just intervened to give the currency some support .
one moscow-based trader tweets that the russian central bank sold dollars and bought rouble to stem the downturn .
fiquant ( @ fiquant ) intervention by the cbr in the usdrub 500 m the rouble did indeed recover , but then staggered back towards the 58-to-the-dollar mark for the first time ever .
rouble vs dollar , december 12 2014 reuters katie martin ( @ katie martin fx ) ok , i know i 've said the wheels are coming off the ruble before , but it is proper tin hat time in moscow now .
the greek stock market has dropped by another 2 % in early trading in athens , extending the losses this week to over 20 % .
efthimia efthimiou ( @ efiefthimiou ) # greece # ase at the opening -2.10 %
the selloff is up pace , pushing the ftse 100 down by 80 points to 6381 .
the fallers list is led by coca-cola hellenic - greece 's largest company , which bottles soft drinks in 28 countries..
fear is rising in europe 's markets the euro stoxx 50 volatility index is up 9.8 % today .
that shows a rise in risk aversion .
another sign of nerves and pessimism in the markets ; the interest rate on german bonds has hit a new low .
investors continue to pile into bunds today , driving up the price to record highs .
that has pushed down the yield on 10-year bunds to just 0.65 % ; a remarkably low rate of return .
katie martin ( @ katie martin fx ) 10y bund yield down to new record low of 0.651 % .
alles ist nicht so awesome .

documents.title: euro markets in the red
text: european stock markets have fallen in early trading , but not by as much as feared .
the ftseurofirst300 is down 0.5 % at the open , as those fears over the eurozone economy , greece and china 's economy all chip away at confidence .
in the city , the ftse 100 has lost 50 points to 6409 .
mining and energy stocks are among the bigger fallers.. reuters

documents.title: russian rouble hits new lows
text: an information board showing exchange rates of the russian rouble yesterday .
pavel/smertin pavel/itar-tass photo/corbis the russian rouble has hit a new record low this morning , as yesterday 's interest rate hike fails to provide meaningful support .
it has slipped to 57 roubles to the us dollar , down from 56.4 last night , adding to the 40 % depreciation already this year .
financial acrobat ( @ finansakrobat ) one dollar is now exchanged for 57.6995 rubles .
it was 35 this summer .
it 's confirmation that ( as we covered in yesterday 's liveblog ) , sticking interest rates up from 9.5 % to 10.5 % is n't going to fix russia 's problems .
rouble vs the us dollar over the last year .
reuters economists fear that the tumble in the oil price and sanctions over ukraine will drive russia into a deep recession in 2015 .
russia 's stock market has also fallen in early trading , wiping another 2.5 % off the rts index .

we 're approaching the stage where it 's more newsworthy for the rouble to not hit a record low , as the bbc 's steve rosenberg tweets : steve rosenberg ( @ bbcstever ) seem to be saying this every day now , but the rouble has just hit a new low against the dollar .
steve rosenberg ( @ bbcstever ) orthodox church warned of bad luck for moscow if giant evil eye installed on skyscraper .
idea was scrapped .
( has n't stopped rouble falling )
traders are also nervous after the greek prime minister warned on thursday that the eurozone debt crisis could erupt again .
antonis samaras predicted chaos if his government were to collapse over this month 's presidential vote , triggering yesterday 's share and bond rout .
darren courtney-cook , head of trading at central markets investment management , summed up the mood this morning : greece is rearing its ugly head again .
it 's not good for the euro zone .

documents.title: the agenda : european markets in gloomy mood
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the world economy , the financial markets , the eurozone and business .
worries over the eurozone economy and the political crisis unfolding in greece are weighing on the markets again today .

investors in europe are feeling blue after yesterday 's cocktail of bad news , including french core inflation turning negative and a weak take-up of cheap loans offered by the european central bank .
the prospect of snap elections in greece next year is also looming , and wiped another 7 % off the athens exchange yesterday .
and traders woke up to more gloom this morning ; chinese industrial production growth has slowed , to 7.2 % year-on-year .
as bloomberg explains here , it 's the latest signal that its economy is slowing .

jasper lawler of cmc markets says : european markets look set to open sharply lower at the end of the week as chinese and japanese industrial production levels sink in november exacerbating concerns that the neither the asian nor european slowdown is being met with enough central bank liquidity .
and ig 's stan shamu reports continuing pessimism after eurozone banks only applied for barely half the ¬400bn of cheap credit dangled before them by the ecb yesterday .

here 's ig 's opening calls : ftse : 6390 , down 72 points german dax : 9762 , down 101 points french cac : 4179 , down 47 points spanish ibex : 10336 , down 96 points italian ftse mib : 18995 , down 206 points coming up later : inflation data from spain and italy is due this morning we get data for the uk 's construction output in october , at 9.30am and eurozone industrial production data for october at 10am .
we 'll be tracking all the main events through the day
